Quercus robur,Q. robur has a more obovate leaf shape with a cordate or auriculate leaf base. The leaf underside is less (or not at all) hairy. The petioles are shorter and generally not groved and the acorns are smaller and pedunculate., Quercus robur x petraea, Such hybrids tends to have non sessile acorns (of Q. robur) and long petioles and hairy leaves (of Q. petraea)
A strong and long lived tree with distinct lobed leaves and acorn fruit (borne in involucre 'cups'. Flowers with leaves. Less vulnerable to insect damage than other Oaks.
